data.title: Address, Interiors, Images, Price and More
data.meta_description: Inspired by the mythical Atlantic island, Mukesh Ambani house, Antilia is an inspiration for many interior enthusiasts. Let’s take a look inside one of the most renowned structures of India - the Antilia.
data.text:
Born in Yemen, Mukesh Ambani, the son of legendary visionary and entrepreneur Dhirubhai Ambani, inherited his name and position but not his wealth. He was born with a silver spoon, but turning it into gold was all Mukesh’s passion, hard work, and business sense. The Mukesh Ambani house was built on a multi-billion empire, brick by brick where he poured his blood, sweat, and tears into everything he did. And it was this perseverance, and his drive to achieve better things that motivated him and his family to move from a small 2-bedroom apartment to a 27-floor megastructure, in one of the best and most expensive neighbourhoods of India. Today, the building stands tall and shines with pride as a symbol of Ambani’s wealth, power, and stature as one of the richest men in Asia and the world with a net worth of 2.2 billion USD. If you want to know more about Antilla than just the given Mukesh Ambani house name, read on!

Things we covered for you

+

-

Looking Back at Antilia, The House of Mukesh Ambani

The 4,00,000 square-ft plot was purchased in July 2002 by Antilia Commercial Private Limited, a commercial business entity owned by Mukesh Ambani. The property was bought for a whopping 215 million rupees; which is approximately 3 million USD.

There was a slew of architects involved in the planning process. While Chicago-based architectural firm Perkins & Will and California-based interior design firm Hirsch Bedner Associates took care of the design of the house, Leighton Contractors, the Australian company, was outsourced for its construction. However, the building was eventually completed by B.E. Billimoria & Company Limited.

Antilia currently hosts residence to Mukesh Ambani, his wife Nita Ambani, his two sons, Akash Ambani, his wife Shloka Mehta and their new-born Prithvi Akash Ambani, Anand Ambani, and his only daughter, Isha Ambani and her husband, Anand Piramal.

Mukesh Ambani’s House Price

According to the recent estimate, each square foot of real estate can cost anywhere between 80,000 to 85,000 rupees. Mukesh Ambani’s Antilia is built on an area of 400,000 square feet. The Ambani family residence is estimated to cost around one to two billion USD that is between 6,000 crores to 12,000 crore rupees. This estimate was delivered by Forbes magazine.

Mukesh Ambani House Mumbai Address

Antilia, Mukesh Ambani’s house is located in one of Mumbai’s prime cuts of land; the most expensive property coming second only to Buckingham Palace. If you want to know the Mukesh Ambani house location, it stands majestically on Altamount Road on Cumballa Hill situated in the Southern part of Mumbai.

Mukesh Ambani’s House Interior

A house as grand as the man himself, the phrase ‘living large’ got a whole new meaning when Antilia house came along with her 27 floors decked in grandiose. The skyscraper was built to withstand an earthquake of magnitude 8.0 on the Richter scale. Even though it is a 27-floor building, its estimated height is that of a 60-story building owing to its height and massive high ceilings; each floor is said to be as tall as a 2-story building. It is said to be the tallest house owned by a single family in the world standing at 173 metres which are around 568 feet. But that point is constantly argued upon as Antilia also houses around 600 staff members. These staff members including bodyguards, assistants, and other security personnel have a huge room allocated for their relaxation.

The Ambani’s moved into their new residence in September 2011, after a grand puja and Vastu ceremony that was conducted by 50 renowned pandits.

The interior of the Mukesh Ambani House is said to be inspired by a mythical Atlantic Island. The theme is primarily focused on the sun and the lotus engraved into marble, stone, crystals, and mother-of-pearl.

Mukesh Ambani House Inside Features and Amenities

If you are wondering about the Mukesh Ambani house features, his passion for cars is well-known and that is reflected in the six floors dedicated to parking alone! His garage space can accommodate 168 cars. Not just this, Ambani has his own private car service station on the seventh floor. As you probably cannot see from the images, we can inform you from news reports that the house was decked with a beautiful and prominent temple, an ice cream parlour, a salon, a dance studio, a health spa, a ballroom, a yoga studio, and multiple suites meant to host guests. The mansion also houses 3 Olympic-sized swimming pools. The top six floors of the Ambani’s mansion have been sealed off as their private, residential living space.

Not just that, the Antilla boasts of not one, two, but three rooftop helipads, as well as a 50-seater movie theatre, a Babylon themed hanging gardens, nine elevators, and accommodation for nearly 600 staff members of the property. One other area in the Antilia maze is the Ambani family’s snow room where they go to get away from the life-sucking Mumbai heat. The walls of the snow room are designed to dispense artificial snowflakes that give out Antarctic vibes. How cool is that!

Wondering how the family members move from one area to another without breaking a sweat? Well, thanks to the 9 elevators that run at super speed. These elevators are assigned to different sets of floors. There are separate elevators for the Ambani family, staff members, and guests. And in case, this would not suffice, there are three helipads built on the megastructure. However, they are not yet functional as permits from the Director-General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) and the Central defence and Environment ministries are still pending.

Mukesh Ambani House Interior Design

The Mukesh Ambani house interior design is not to be taken lightly as the designers for the interiors and construction were chosen after much research. We cannot give you a single Mukesh Ambani house interior designer name, as it required not one but two companies to make this home happen. Impressed by the work of two renowned companies in the United States i.e. Hirsch Bedner Associates, and Perkins & Will at the Mandarin Oriental New York, Nita Ambani handed over the monumental task to them. The construction for which, began in 2004 by Leighton Asia. After altering the floor plans and design concepts, the 27-storeyed cantilevered beam designed house, makes it as tall as a building with 60 floors, at a gigantic 570 feet. Keeping the design of the sun and lotus in mind, the interior of the Mukesh Ambani house is abundant with marbles and crystals, with no room being similar to another. No wonder the construction took about 7 years to complete!

Mukesh Ambani house theme is based on pastels, which adds a serene vibe to the whole mansion; with a majority of its premises set in different hues of brown, beige, and cream, Antilia is truly a sight to behold. The aesthetic furniture complements the serenity of the interior and the finishing touch is given by the chandeliers that hang from every ceiling.

Mukesh Ambani’s House Images

After hearing so much about the multi-billion-dollar structure, is your curiosity getting the better of you? We’ve got you covered. Here are some photos of Antilia, the Mukesh Ambani house in all its glory.

Antilla Construction Dates

Beginning in 2004, the Ambani residence Antilia underwent intense development that lasted for seven years, until 2010. The Ambani family didn’t actually move in until the end of 2011, which fueled rumours that the mansion had Vastu-related problems.

Then Mukesh Ambani House Land and Vastu Shastra Controversy

Most of us are very religious and believe in the almighty above for our well-being more than riches and fame. The same is true for the Ambani house floors. There was even some controversy in 2011 as to whyMukesh Ambani’s family hadn’t moved out of their Sea Wind apartment and moved into Antilia. The most popular reason cited in news reports was that the property was not completely compliant with the ancient Indian architectural doctrine of the Vastu, or the Vastu Shastra. As great believers in the Vastu Shastra for home, they moved into Antilia in 2011 only after the complete pujas were done to remove Vastu defects or Vastu Doshas in the home with a team of about 50 pandits, led by their family priest, over 10 days. As we can see today, the family is still thriving in a happy home. Not just that, India’s second richest man has also built a second home for his family in a 300-acre land in Buckinghamshire.

Then Mukesh Ambani House Land and Vastu Shastra Controversy

Most of us are very religious and believe in the almighty above for our well-being more than riches and fame. The same is true for the Ambani family. There was even some controversy in 2011 as to why Mukesh Ambani’s family hadn’t moved out of their Sea Wind apartment and move into Antilia. The most popular reason cited in news reports was that the property was not completely compliant with the ancient Indian architectural doctrine of the Vastu, or the Vastu Shastra. As great believers in the Vastu Shastra for home, they moved into Antilia in 2011 only after the complete pujas were done to remove Vastu defects or Vastu Doshas in the home with a team of about 50 pandits, led by their family priest, over 10 days. As we can see today, the family is still thriving in a happy home. Not just that, India’s second richest man has also built a second home for his family in a 300-acre land in Buckinghamshire.

Mukesh Ambani London Mansion – Overview

Spending most of the time in lockdowns during the COVID-19 pandemic, the Ambani’s living in their sky-high Antilia residence realised that they needed to purchase another property. So, they decided to spend a nominal amount of Rs. 592 crores, with about 49 bedrooms, as well as a modern medical facility. The Mukesh Ambani London mansion in Buckinghamshire, Stoke Park, also has a shrine that replicated their Indian house, Antilia. The property is steeped in history, as it was constructed more than 900 years ago, by a soldier and scholar called John Penn. After being used as a private residence until 1908, author and sports administrator Nick Lane Jackson converted the property into Britain’s first country club.

Mukesh Ambani New House in London – Key Facts

Here are some of the key facts you may want to know about the massive Mukesh Ambani London house:

According to Bloomberg, this iconic English estate was purchased for USD 70 million

Stoke Park, is a historic estate sprawling across 300 acres of gardens and parklands

The property is located on the English countryside about 40 kms from London

Mukesh Ambani bought the estate from the three King brothers – Hertford, Chester, and Witney, who previously were the owners since 1988

The Kings had invested around USD 30 million to restore the property in 2001, as per Forbes

The property served as the filming location for two popular James Bond films, Goldfinger (1964) and Tomorrow Never Dies (1997)

Mukesh Ambani House in London – Amenities

Luxury drips from every corner of the 300-acre property in Stoke Park. It includes everything from a five-star hotel, lounges, three restaurants, a spa, a gym, to even a 27-hole championship golf course, , a 4,000 sq. ft. fitness centre, as well as 13 tennis courts!

Mukesh Ambani’s Stoke Park Estate

For £57 million in April 2021, Mukesh Ambani acquired the renowned Stoke Park estate, which had a five-star hotel and one of Europe’s best golf courses (Rs 592 crore).

Reliance Industrial Investments and Holdings Ltd (RIIHL) bought the 300-acre Georgian country club and opulent golf resort in Buckinghamshire, London, primarily as a “trophy asset” to glam up RIL’s global portfolio and expand RIIHL’s consumer and hotel footprint.

RIL promised at the time of the purchase that the mansion would remain a members-only club and that the business was considering improving the opulent and sporty amenities on the historic site.

RIL stated in a statement following the purchase that “RIIHL will look to develop the sports and leisure facilities at this heritage location, while fully complying with the planning standards and local legislation.”

It begs to be noted that, in a UK Grade-I structure like the Stoke Park, changing a doorknob requires written consent from English Heritage.

A recent media report claimed that the Ambani family was considering making Stoke Park their primary residence because “the experience of spending the pandemic in the 4,00,000-sqft Altamount Road residence, Antilia, made the family feel the need for a second home.” This led to rumours that the Ambani family was planning to relocate to London.

Mukesh Ambani’s Stoke Park Estate History

The renowned King family of the UK owned International Group (IG), which sold the Stoke Park estate to Ambani. The country club has been owned by the Roger King-founded International Hospitals Group since 1908, but in 2018, they decided to put the mansion up for sale. Stoke Park was a private home before it changed to a country club in 1908.

The Stoke Park estate, an opulent building with a documented history spanning more than 900 years, is intertwined with a lot of history. The English country club has served as the backdrop for numerous Hollywood productions, including two James Bond movies, Godfinger with Sean Connery and Tomorrow Never Dies with Pierce Brosnan.

Amenities at Mukesh Ambani’s Stoke Park Estate

The 27-hole golf course at Stoke Park, which is adjacent to London’s Heathrow airport, continues to be the property’s focal point. You can see Windsor Castle from the Stoke Poges Golf Club, which Harry Shapland Colt designed in 1908.

The luxurious amenities of Stoke Park include 49 opulent guestrooms and suites, 13 tennis courts, and 14 acres of private gardens. These areas include hunting, riding, and sport fishing. According to reports, the Ambanis added a temple and a state-of-the-art medical facility to the estate.

The Stoke Park clubhouse, a Palladian palace constructed in 1789, is one of 5,000 structures in the UK with Grade-I listed historical designation.

Find Your Dream Home Like the Ambani’s!

Not only is the Mukesh Ambani house name quite popular and known by almost everybody in India, the interiors of the Mukesh Ambani house, Antilia, also still remains somewhat of a mystery and I guess we’ll never really find out. Calling it a mansion is a serious understatement, But Mukesh Ambani and his family found their home within the engraved marble. You, too, can find your perfect home here at NoBroker, there are homes for every budget and they all come WITHOUT brokerage! You can become Mukesh Ambani’s neighbour! , also check out interior design services in Mumbai. To check out flats for rent near Mukesh Ambani’s house click the link below.
